page.title: 16EARL HOWE
page.content: The most famous family in Langar were the{Howes}who lived at the Hall. {Richard}was the hero of the family. Born in 1725 he went on a round the world voyage at aged 15 as commander of the English fleet.At aged 69 he won the first naval battle of the Napoleonic Wars in 1794.It was known as{"The Glorious 1st of June". The main idea was to intercept the grain ships going to{France from {America}to prevent famine. Earl Howe's fleet captured many French ships but the grain ships escaped. For his victory he became a hero and {King George 3rd }presented him with a diamond studded sword.Also in Langar Church,where he is buried hangs the tapestry taken from a Spanish ship by Admiral Howe.
